trapomino

Class Trapomino

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • trapomino.Trapomino
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Trapomino
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    This is the main class of Trapomino, it runs the game, initializes the variables, creates the frame, manages the KeyListener and MouseListener, and alters the states, sounds, and settings of the game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This enum contains all of the game states.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method sets the game to running, adds a MouseListener and KeyListener, and starts the thread.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This method sets running to false and terminates the program.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method manages the tick system to make sure that calculations and processes are synchronized with the program's clock.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method of the game, it creates and runs Trapomino, sets up the JFrame and the game's window, creates the ErrorHandle, and starts the game.
        Parameters:
        args - - the default parameter for the main method.

      • loadSettings

        public static void loadSettings()
        This method loads the settings from saveSettings.txt and the current level from saveLevel.txt. The method then stores the level completion status into the levels Array. If this method encounters an error, it will write to the ErrorHandle.

      • changeState

        public static void changeState(Trapomino.STATE state)
        This method changes the state of the game to the given state.
        Parameters:
        state - - The state or the current screen of the game

      • playMusic

        public void playMusic()
        This method will change the music if the music timer has expired or the music was changed, as long as the music is not muted. If the above is met, the method will reset the timer, play the new audio with the current musicName as found in the Music folder, and set musicChanged to false again. If an error is encountered while changing the music, it will write to the ErrorHandle.

      • stopMusic

        public static void stopMusic()
        This method will stop the music from playing.

      • setMusic

        public static void setMusic(java.lang.String musicName)
        This method will set the music to the music of the given name.
        Parameters:
        musicName - - the name of the file of the music to set

      • playSound

        public static void playSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        This method will play the sound with the given name as found in the Music folder, as long as the sound is not muted. If an error is encountered while playing the sound, it will write to the ErrorHandle.
        Parameters:
        soundName - - the file name of the sound as found in the Music folder

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent ke)
        This method overrides the KeyListener method so the class can be implemented.
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        ke - - the KeyEvent of the typed key
